meanings.sent1: She carefully unblinded the child after the game.
meanings.sent2: The doctor unblinded the patient before the examination.
meanings.sent3: In the magic show, the magician unblinded the volunteer to reveal a surprise.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise unblinded the world with its bright light.
meanings.sent5: With a swift motion, he unblinded himself and saw the truth.

meanings.definition: Make (something) no longer hidden or obscured.
meanings.sent1: The unveiling ceremony unblinded the new statue for all to see.
meanings.sent2: The investigation unblinded the truth behind the mystery.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rain unblinded the hidden leak in the roof.
meanings.sent4: Her smile unblinded his heart to her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The spotlight unblinded the singer, revealing her talent to the audience.
